One thing keeping my mind off all the boolshit: https://t.co/24nxE1JLbe
"Hurl with rage" is my new favorite phrase.
Trump makes me want to hurl with rage #DumpTrump
What has the world come to? Again? Argh.
I can't wait to bitch about all the outfits! #GoldenGlobes
The overuse of the word 'brazen' on the news makes me want to hurl with rage.
Does it make me evil if I (not so secretly) wish that Trump died instead of all those damn celebrity deaths last year?
Gotta love boids, they're modern dinos! Along with reptiles, of course. #NationalBirdDay
All other Xmas related movies I watch tend to be horror from the 70's and 80's, the best two decades for horror!
Top 3 Xmas Carol movies: Scrooge (1951), Muppet Xmas Carol (1992), Scrooged (1988)
@Nick_Offerman should play Conway Twitty in a biopic! #DreamCasting
Watched "Silent Night, Deadly Night" 1 and 2. The first was good, but the second had the awesome "Garbage Day!!!" scene. #GarbageDay!
Almost time for my "Xmas" tradition of watching various versions of A Christmas Carol (Muppet Xmas Carol being my favorite, 50's one is 2nd)
I forgot how awesome the Phantasm series is! Re-watching the first 3 helps of course. Coscarelli, you genius! #Boyyy!!!
Phantasm marathon tonight (I haven't seen the 4th and 5th)! Yippee #Boyyy!!!
@RealDaveWright Aw, yr a millenial. Well, it's not your age but what you do with it, as they say (or as I say).
Watching The Goonies for the gazillionth time. I forgot this came out the year of my birth. I feel old. Or young. Or old? I'm confused.
@RealDaveWright If you don't win Survivor, I'm gonna be really pissed.
We haven't even begun Trump's 4-year daily dose of scandal, and he's already done enough that would get any other prez thrown out #DumpTrump
I love Thandie Newton more and more and more! Oh, and poor Bernard! #Westworld
Now Canada will have American 'refugees' #ElectionResults
Ha ha, luckily I'm in Canada and have dual. I might never go back to the states now... #ElectionResults
Well, it's gonna be a bleak winter with all this Trump nonsense... #ElectionResults
Crazy @WalkingDead_AMC premier! I'll miss the dead. But I can't wait to find out where all this leads compared to the amazing graphic novels
If anyone hasn't seen Bob Roberts yet, now is the perfect time. #TrumpSucks
I'm not gonna bother watching any more Preacher, but I can't wait to watch more of Walking Dead in the fall.
They should have had Ruth Negga be Grinderbinder! I mean, really. So many things wrong with Preacher. Unlike Walking Dead, which I love.
Finally watched the @PreacherAMC premier. I like those actors, but I don't agree at all with the casting and the direction they're going.
Alsoooo, counting the days till next year. Cuz of Twin Peaks of course! I can't fakking wait!
The Night Manager (AMC): Pretty good! I love Hugh Laurie and I love Tom Hiddleston in just about anything.
Preacher (AMC): Loved the graphic novel...but...Another case of horrible casting. I'm still gonna check it out, though.
#RIPPrince So sad. This year seems pretty dangerous for aging celebs... I hope I'm wrong, though...
I love Scarjo, but she was horribly miscast for #GhostintheShell, and I won't be watching it. Reminds me of Emma Stone...Hawaiian my ass.
I could have given up on The Walking Dead when they killed off Shane, or even Andrea, but I stuck with it. #TWD
I haven't given up on The @WalkingDead_AMC , maybe its cuz I've read the graphic novels, or just cuz I love it no matter what. #TWD
I just made my picks for the Championship in The #DailyShow #ThirdMonthMania tournament. Vote now! https://t.co/kD235rSpxJ
Damn, they didn't show who it was...I bet it wasn't Carl, though. #TWDFinale
Here comes Negan! Whuh oh! #TWDFinale
Yes! The "Kingdom" dudes are showing up too! #TWDFinale
I voted for @BostonPizza in @pizzamondays' The Pizza Wars - Vote for your fav pizzeria to win pizza for a year https://t.co/lAt0EFOj3X
Omg, I KNEW it!!! Negan on the season finale! And I hope Darryl and Maggie are okay... #TheWalkingDead
I like Morgan, but I think his philosophy doesn't do much good in a zombie apocalypse. #TWD
Carol is straight-up awesome. Even when she freaks out and has panic attacks. #TheWalkingDead
I bet Negan's gonna show his nasty head right on the last episode... #TheWalkingDead
You know as soon as everyone starts feelin' comfortable that something horrible is going to happen! @TheWalkingDead
I love all the cute couples right now! On Walking Dead, that is. Especially #richonneisreal
Wow, Trump's mouth really DOES look like a puckered butthole!
I made my predictions for The #DailyShow #ThirdMonthMania tournament. Set your bracket now! https://t.co/kD235rSpxJ
I wonder why Trump keeps winning all these damn caucuses even though most people don't like him? Argh. #TrumpSucks
Dark Waters (1993): pretty good! It's like a cross between Hellraiser and Suspiria, or something.
Viy (1967): Pretty dated in FX, but still way better than the remake. Simple and creepy.
The Conspirator (2010): watched this last week too, and it was pretty good. An interesting perspective on the Lincoln assassination.
Glory (1989): Finally watched this a week ago. Loved it! Some peeps from Shawshank too, and everyone's at the top of their game.
BUT, the doc "What Happened Miss Simone?" looks good and I will totally watch that. #NinaSimone
Nina (2016): I will never see this lame biopic. They shoulda got Viola Davis or someone else. #NinaSimone
OMG Michonne and Rick! And Jesus is here!!!! Love it!!! #TheWalkingDead
Ghomeshi trial: 99% of abuse cases I believe the victims, but here the only real evidence they might have is that he's a douche.
@Rhoninho Nope, brain still intact. I don't think Trump's brain has been intact for a looooong time, though.
That MJ TV movie: I think it would be better if they just got some guy with vitiligo instead. #MichaelJackson
Seriously, I would be relatively happy if either Bernie Sanders or Hilary Clinton win. But I will get rid of my citizenship if Trump does.
Peyton Place: watched it last night. Good but they really did 'sanitize' it. I gotta read the book now...
Solomon Northup: I didn't realize he ended up disappearing again later on! They should do a sequel of sorts (to 12 Years a Slave)!
Oscars: I'm not boycotting it, I want to see what Chris Rock says. But I do hope next year's will be better. #OscarsSoWhite
Still relevant today: https://t.co/2Q8YBxsQTx #MLKDay
Now Alan Rickman? He was awesome. Yikes, it reminds me of 1997. 2016 is a dangerous year for celebs.
David Bowie is gone! So sad... I always hoped he would live forever.
Yay, that loser Martin Shkreli got arrested! It's an Xmas miracle!
SNL last night: Ryan Gosling was good! Probably one of the best episodes this season. Oh, and Mike Myers was awesome too!
ANTM: I wanted Lacey to win, but Nyle was a close second. He's super hot.
I bet now people will go to The Revenant just to see the bear scene, har har. #BearRape
Noooo! Scott Weiland is gone! He was such a talented singer. RIP
Meanwhile, Homeland season 5 is pretty good. Better than last season, for sure.
I wish they had gotten Patrick Warburton as Negan, but Jeffrey Dean Morgan is a good choice too.
Now I'm watching Talking Dead, as usual.
OMG, just watched the latest @WalkingDead_AMC ! And the sneak peek is all about Negan! I can't wait!!!
There, I've finally got myself caught up on all the stupid reviews. Phew!
Gozu: Super weird. Like a Japanese David Lynch movie. Or weirder, if that's possible. And it is (if you make it to the end)
Colbert: he'll never beat Fallon, like he never beat Jon Stewart, but his show is good nonetheless
Queen Margot (1994): Good! Yes another reason not to be in a royal family. But also, tres romantique, hehe
The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo (2009): This is so much better than the American version! Not that it was bad, just not as good
Down By Law (1986): Tom Waits is a genius. And so is. Jarmusch. Supa-cool.
The Brotherhood of the Wolf (2001): I loved it! Beautifully shot, wonderfully done. I'll even forgive the CGI parts. And Mani was awesome.
Big Eyes (2014): Good! What a crazy (true) story, too. Burton is back making good films, yay
Snowpiercer: I finally watched it, and now I know why everyone seems to love it. Amazing. We need more weirdly awesome movies like this!
A Streetcar Named Desire (1951): Wow, I never really knew what it was about so it kinda blew me away. Total classic.
East of Eden (1955): James Dean, man. Pretty good. But I bet Rebel Without a Cause is better.
Soldier's Girl: Woo-hoo, Lee Pace. This movie is really good, and sad, and I didn't even realize it was based on a true story! Yikes.
House of Cards (s3): I'm finally done binge-watching all the seasons! Who knew I'd be interested in a political show. But I love it!
The White Buffalo (1977): Some old dude told me about this film. It was pretty bad though. Thanks a lot, random old dude
Suspiria: I finally saw this. And I love it. Weird and stylish and creepy. I gotta watch more Argento movies, clearly.
Slaughter High (1986): I love it! Wonderfully silly slasher. Oh the 80's, how wonderful that decade was, at least for slashers...
Don't Look Now (1973): why do people like this movie? It's soooo boring! Plus the trance reminds me of Carrie's mother's death(gross sounds)
Boardwalk Empire (S2): Yeah, I'm a little behind. But the ending of season 2 was pretty cray-cray.
The Human Centipede: I finally watched it out of curiosity. Pretty silly. And reminds me of the much more entertaining South Park episode
Wolf Hall (mini-series): It was okay. Interesting take on the Boleyn affair, but it was kinda boring. But I love Damien Lewis in anything
True Detective (S2): reallly not as good as the first season. A resounding 'meh'. Even though Vaughn and Ferrell showed their acting chops
Wall Street: finally watched it recently. Good movie. The tech is pretty dated. and Wall Street's power seems to hidden better or something
Yikes, I haven't been on here in awhile. And its been weirdly hot in Vancouver. Me no likey.
